result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Eduardo Mares was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by September 21, 2016 or a civil judgment be entered.
DNA sample ordered and DNA assessment to be paid by September 21, 2016.

No contact with victims in case 16CM22 and in case 13CM3981.
No violent contact with anyone. 
No new criminal law violation arising to probable cause.

Successfully complete Anger Management.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Eduardo Mares

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
 
Defendant sentenced to serve days 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 26 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months. If revoked court authorizes huber for work ONLY.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:       
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victims in case 16CM22 and in case 13CM3981.
     *   No violent contact with anyone. 
     *   No new criminal law violation arising to probable cause.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by September 21, 2016
          or a civil judgement be entered.
     *   DNA sample ordered and DNA assessment to be paid by 
          September 21, 2016.
 
20 day appeal rights given.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Court ordered Jury Trial date of July 11, 2016 VACATED.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New attorney present for today's proceedings. Case remains calendared for final pre-trial on March 21, 2016 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 31.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record.

Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests jury trial date. 

Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 31.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Eduardo Mares in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
